programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Mary Kay Letourneau, 34 year-old married schoolteacher and mother, was having sex with a 12 year old student, and the story grabbed headlines around the world; it's only the first in a series of wild revelations.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Reverend Randall Foos says it was just an unfortunate accident when his car hit and killed 19-year-old Sara Casey as she rode her bicycle, but a civil suit revealed more than the eye could see, or couldn't, that turned this accident into a crime.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: No one argued that Naveed Haq suffered from mental health issues; he walked into the Seattle Jewish Federation office, started shooting, wounding six women and killing one; the jury has to decide if his mental health issues make it less of a crime.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: When 15-month-old Ava Worthington became ill with a cold, her parents Carl and Raylene did what they always did, and insisted the power of prayer was the only cure she needed.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Both sides in the Doctor Jack Kevorkian trial argued over video of a press conference done after Thomas Hyde's death; the State is seeking to make its case to convict Dr. Jack Kevorkian.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Thomas Hyde's fiancée Heidi Fernandez took the stand to tell the jury about the man whose death is at the forefront of this case; Fernandez remembered him as a person who was in control.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Thomas Hyde's fiancée Heidi Fernandez told jurors Hyde was living in hell with ALS; she said Dr. Jack Kevorkian offered him a little control back over his life; Heidi Fernandez finished testifying in an emotional scene both on the stand and off.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The press conference Dr. Kevorkian gave after Thomas Hyde passed away set off a big debate in court, as both sides weigh in on jury instructions.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The prosecution accused the defense of trying to distract jurors from the fact the doctor was charged with breaking Michigan's assisted-suicide ban.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Geoffrey Fieger's closing argument in the trial that focused on the death of Thomas Hyde and assisted suicide.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: Doctor Jack Kevorkian's attorney called the jury the conscience of the community and the country; he tried to show that Kevorkian should not have been prosecuted over the death of Thomas Hyde.

programme.title: The Trials Of Dr. Death
programme.desc: The prosecution told jurors during its closing argument that the law applies to everyone; the judge said this is not a stage and he did not want emotional scenes.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors accusing Scott Nelson of intentionally murdering Jennifer Fulford gave their final remarks to jurors.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Scott Nelson's defense team delivered their closing arguments to jurors in his murder trial. His lawyer claimed Nelson never premeditated the suffocating and stabbing Death of Jennifer Fulford.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: After just four hours of deliberations, the jury rendered their verdict in Scott Nelson's role in Jennifer Fulford's death. Next, the life of a once homeless drifter and former-felon-turned-murderer was now in the hands of these jurors.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Cold, calculated, and premeditated were the aggravating factors prosecutors contended led Scott Nelson to kill Jennifer Fulford.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Bank robberies was on Scott Nelson's resume years before he graduated to being a convicted killer in Jennifer Fulford's death. Prosecutors brought in two cases of him when he attempted to rob bank branches with threats of a bomb and a gun.

programme.title: Nanny Abduction Murder Trial
programme.desc: Prosecutors turned the jury's attention to victim-impact statements. First up, was Jennifer Fulford's daughter who testified remotely for the jury. Next was her son. Fulford was killed on the same exact Day her granddaughter was born.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The death of John O'Keefe took a mental toll on the State's key witness. Jennifer McCabe was with the defendant when they found the victim in the snow.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: The State's key witness claimed the defendant changed her story about what happened to John O'Keefe multiple times the morning he died.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors would hear next from the other woman who had been with Karen Read and Jennifer McCabe when they found John O'Keefe.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Other Woman At The Scene
programme.desc: Yet another person who was with Karen read at the scene where John O'Keefe was found testified that she kept repeating: I hit him, I hit him.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.desc: Jurors heard more testimony about how frantic Karen Read seemed to be at the scene where her boyfriend, John O'Keefe, was found.

programme.title: Killer Or Cover-Up Murder Trial
programme.sub-title: The Two Sisters And The Aruba Vacation
programme.desc: The jury listened to details about a trip to Aruba that happened a few weeks before John O'Keefe was killed. On this trip was the defendant and the victim, along with a number of family and friends.

programme.title: Judgment With Ashleigh Banfield
programme.desc: Prosecutors say the death of 16-year-old Neil Beagley was completely preventable; so much so his parents are charged with criminally negligent homicide.
